title: Gabrielle Union, 46, has barely aged since Bring It On 19 years ago
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Gabrielle Union hasn't aged since she shot to fame in movie Bring It On.

The actress, now 46, made a name for herself nearly two decades ago when she played Isis in the 2002 cheerleading film.

Gabrielle, whose 47th birthday is looming, was the spitting image of herself in her Bring It On character.

She got her daughter Kaavia a matching outfit for the spectacular occasion.

The mother showcased her abs in a crop top and miniskirt in the same colours and with the team name Clovers written across the chest.

(Image: gabunion/Instagram)

In the caption, Gabrielle was confident in her good looks as she said she had "brought it".

The movie star also shared a clip which included segments of her part in Bring It On.

In the movie, Gabrielle played the head cheerleader of the Clovers team as they come head-to-head against the Toros.

(Image: gabunion/Instagram)

(Image: gabunion/Instagram)

The TV star had the starring role alongside fellow stars Kirsten Dunst, Eliza Dushku, Jesse Bradford and Natina Reed.

Gabrielle raises her 11-month-old daughter with her husband Dwyane Wade; the couple were happily married in 2014.

Bring It On was her breakout role which followed her supporting roles in films such as 10 Things I Hate About You.

She also had parts on TV shows throughout the 1990s which kick started her acting career.
description: Gabrielle Union has a starring role on cheerleading movie Bring It On in 2000
